snippet: At least 30 people have died in clashes between those celebrating the ouster of President Mohamed Morsi and those demanding his reinstatement.
abstract: At least 30 people have died in clashes between those celebrating the ouster of Egyptian Pres Mohamed Morsi and those demanding his reinstatement; actions suggest that the military's removal of Morsi has only worsened the deep polarization between Islamists and their opponents.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Mayy El Sheikh, David D. Kirkpatrick and Kareem Fahim from Cairo; Rick Gladstone from New York; Alan Cowell from London; and Peter Baker from Washington.

lead_paragraph: At least 30 people have died in clashes between those celebrating the ouster of President Mohamed Morsi and those demanding his reinstatement.

headline.sub: At Least 30 People Dead in Increasingly Divided Nation
headline.main: Mayhem in Cairo as Morsi Backers Fight for Return
headline.print_headline: Mayhem in Cairo as Morsi Backers Fight for Return
